source_sentence: 爾時那拏天復說大明曰。
translation: It was then that the god Naṇa again spoke the great luminosity, saying.

source_sentence: 那謨那拏酤鉢囉寫(一)吠設囉(二合)嚩拏蘇多寫(二)摩賀(引)虞呬也(二合)緊捺囉(二合)寫(三)彌尾也(二合)尾摩(引)那嚩(引)悉那寫(四)阿他(引)覩那拏酤鉢囉寫(五)摩賀(引)虞呬也(二合)緊捺囉(二合)寫(六)紇哩(二合)捺野摩(引)嚩[口*栗]多(二合)野沙也(二合引)彌(七)阿嚩(引)[(曷-人+乂)*頁]曩(八)阿(引)尾舍曩(九)布囉(引)鉢曩(十)囕誐(引)鉢曩(十一)嚕捺(引)鉢曩(十二)滿馱曩(十三)摩(引)囉赧(十四)怛囉(二合引)薩曩(十五)多哩惹(二合)曩(十六)薩擔(二合)婆曩(十七)昝婆曩(十八)謨歇曩(十九)薩哩嚩(二合引)蜜怛囉(二合引)赧鉢囉(二合)摩他曩(二十)那謨那拏酤鉢囉(引)野(二十一)那謨吠設囉(二合)嚩那野(二十二)那謨尾嚕博叉野(二十三)那謨尾嚕茶迦野(二十四)那謨特哩(二合)底囉(引)瑟吒囉(三合引)野(二十五)那謨惹致羅(引)野(二十六)那謨藥叉孽那(引)野(二十七)那謨摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合引)野(二十八)那謨布蘭拏(二合)跋捺囉(二合引)野(二十九)那謨薩哩嚩(二合)尾儞也(二合引)滿怛囉(二合)布[口*爾]多(引)野(三十)摩賀(引)鉢囉(二合)[(曷-人+乂)*頁]囉那馱囉(引)野(三十一)毘摩那(引)捺(引)野(三十二)婆野鉢囉(二合)捺野(三十三)入嚩(二合)梨多難那(三十四)鉢囉(二合)[(曷-人+乂)*頁]囉那[(曷-人+乂)*頁]薩他(二合)野(三十五)蘇尾摩羅儞室多(三十六)鉢囉(二合)賀(引)囉那朗訖哩(二合)設哩囉(引)野(三十七)薩哩嚩(二合)儞嚩孽那耨倪也(二合引)多(引)野(三十八)贊捺囉(二合)蘇哩也(二合)塞建(二合)馱達囉(引)野(三十九)那拏酤鉢囉(引)野(四十)瞖呬曳(二合引)呬(四十一)沒囉(二合)撼摩(二合)薩底曳(二合)那(四十二)儞嚩薩帝曳(二合)那(四十三)嚩(引)踰部覩部埵(引四十四)鉢囉(二合)尾設鉢囉(二合)尾設(四十五)壹忙設利囕薩哩嚩(二合)禰嚩(引四十六)壹忙誐囉(二合)賀(引)摩(引)嚩(引)[(曷-人+乂)*頁]演凍(四十七)阿(引)尾設演凍(四十八)嚩埵(引)鉢演凍(四十九)摩(引)囉(引)鉢演凍(五十)野禰踰惹那設旦孽覩(五十一)野儞沒囉(二合)撼摩(二合)路葛孽旦(五十二)野儞嚩(引)嚩嚕那(引)羅煬(五十三)印捺囉(二合)孽覩嚩(引五十四)尾數努(二合)路葛孽覩必嚩(引五十五)蘇摩蘇哩也(二合)孽覩必嚩(引五十六)薩怛(二合)多娑怛網(三合)那拏酤鉢囉(五十七)阿(引)葛茶野(五十八)阿(引)哥哩沙(二合)野婆誐鑁(五十九)那拏酤鉢囉(六十)母捺誐(二合)囉母娑囉(六十一)作訖囉(二合)播尼囉(引)倪也(二合)鉢野(引)底(六十二)布哩嚩(二合)儞商印捺囉(二合六十三)捺叉那儞室野摩(六十四)娑多(二合)他(引)儞室鉢室左(二合)彌嚩嚕奴那(引)誐(引六十五)嗢多哩那吠室囉(二合)嚩那娑捺(引六十六)瞖帝儞設(引)播(引)羅(引六十七)阿(引)倪也(二合引)鉢野多儞爹設(六十八)部部那拏酤鉢囉(六十九)摩哩捺(二合)摩哩捺(二合七十)鉢囉(三合)摩哩捺(二合)鉢囉(二合)摩哩捺(二合七十一)酤鉢囉酤鉢囉(七十二)布瑟波(二合)酤鉢囉(七十三)紇哩(二合)捺野酤鉢囉(七十四)呼覩呼覩(七十五)母覩母覩(七十六)[(曷-人+乂)*頁]那[(曷-人+乂)*頁]那(七十七)捺[(曷-人+乂)*頁]捺[(曷-人+乂)*頁](七十八)鉢左鉢左(七十九)親捺親捺(八十)頻捺頻捺(八十一)賀(引)賀(引)賀(引)賀(引八十二)那拏酤鉢囉(八十三)係係係係(八十四)那拏酤鉢囉(八十五)布囉布囉(八十六)布囉野那拏酤鉢囉(八十七)儞尾也(二合)酤鉢囉(八十八)阿(引)倪也(二合)鉢野覩虞呬也(二合)葛(八十九)那拏那拏那拏(九十)儞尼儞尼儞尼(九十一)吽吽(九十二)多致多致(九十三)覩致覩致(九十四)唧致唧致(九十五)唧鉢致莎賀(引九十六)此大明有大威力。

source_sentence: 若以此大明加持安悉香焚燒。
translation: If he burns the incense of Anṣi with this great luminosity, the deeds of the constellations and celestial bodies will be accomplished.
All the deeds he performs in connection with previous lifetimes will be accomplished.
Furthermore, a practitioner first purifies himself.
Then he recites this great luminosity.
He then recites this great luminosity and applies the aniseed incense twenty-one times.

source_sentence: 以此香於那拏天晝像前燒及獻白食。
translation: Using this incense, he burns it in front of the Nāna Heaven's pārijāta image and offers it a white meal.
The practitioner then recites this great teaching a thousand times.
After he recites it a thousand times, he then paints a picture of the image and shakes it.
He then emits a bright light and rewards the practitioner by saying.

source_sentence: 汝於那拏天儀軌曼拏羅成就法悉得成就。
translation: 'You have fully accomplished the maṇḍala method of fulfilling the rituals of the Nāna Heaven.'

source_sentence: 行人見此瑞已即奉獻閼伽。
translation: After seeing this auspicious sign, the practitioner then offers his patronage.

source_sentence: 自此以後行人所作一切成就。
translation: From then on, everything the practitioner does will be accomplished.

source_sentence: 又法當用安悉香誦大明。
translation: Another teaching is to recite the great luminosity with the incense of Ansī.
After blessing it, burn and perfume the sword.
He recites the great luminosity and blesses the sword.
It then lifts and emits a light that does a variety of things.

source_sentence: 乃至三叉輪金剛杵擣杵母捺誐囉等器仗。
translation: It's even a trident wheel, a vajra, a mortar, a pounder, a mother of pestles, and other weapons.

source_sentence: 當如前法加持安悉香焚燒熏之。
translation: He should burn and perfume it with the incense of an esoteric incense, just like the previous teaching.

source_sentence: 即皆舉動放光能作種種事。
translation: They all then move and emit light that's capable of performing a variety of actions.

source_sentence: 又復用白芥子誦大明加持已打天像。
translation: Again, he beats the celestial image with a white mustard seed after reciting the great teaching and blessing.

source_sentence: 復誦大明燒安悉香熏像即放光。
translation: Reciting the great knowledge again, he burns the incense and perfumes the image, and it then emits light.

source_sentence: 乃至梵天那羅延天大自在天毘沙門天摩賀迦羅天等。
translation: Even the Brahmakāyika gods, the Nārāyaṇa gods, the Mahāsāṃghika gods, and the Vaiśravaṇa gods.
They also burn the fragrance of Anshi in the same way as before.

source_sentence: 及誦大明加持像皆放光。
translation: The image glows when it's perfumed by the recitation of the great incense and blessings.

source_sentence: 又復行人依法作曼拏羅。
translation: Again, the practitioner makes a maṇḍala according to the Dharma.
They make offerings with flowers and incense.

source_sentence: 復依法取閼伽瓶滿盛香水。
translation: Again, according to the Dharma, he takes a Shinga vial and fills it with perfume.
Putting it in the mannalā, he burned the fragrance of Ansī and recited the great teaching.

source_sentence: 燒安悉香誦大明加持時。
translation: When he burns the incense of Anshi and recites the great luminous chanting, the image naturally lifts and even moves.

source_sentence: 閼伽瓶自然舉動乃至放光。
translation: The guardian vial naturally lifts and radiates light.
Again, he makes a maṇḍala just like the one before.
He makes offerings with various kinds of flowers and incense.
Then, he rubbed incense on the back of a mirror of light and placed it in the maṇḍala.
He placed it inside the maṇḍala.
Again, he used white mustard seeds and grain flowers.

source_sentence: 誦大明加持已打於鏡面。
translation: After reciting the great incantation, he smacks it on the mirror's face.
He burns the incense of Anshi and recites the great teaching three times.
The mirror then lifts and magnifies its light.

source_sentence: 乃於鏡中得見過去現在未來之事。
translation: In the mirror, he'll be able to see past, present, and future events.

source_sentence: 亦得見於天界四天王天。
translation: They'll also be able to see the four celestial kings of the heavenly realm.
They can see everything from the four heavenly kings down to the dragon palace.

source_sentence: 至於自身及他人壽量亦能得知。
translation: He can also know the lifespan of himself and others.

source_sentence: 又復行人先自齋戒潔淨。
translation: Furthermore, a practitioner first observes precepts and cleanses himself.
After putting on new, good clothing, he then takes a single serving of the Dharma that's well proportioned and complete in appearance.

source_sentence: 然後取一依法相好具足葛波羅。
translation: Then, he takes a well-presented gopalā according to the Dharma.
He washes it with perfume to make it perfectly clean.
He coats it with scented incense.
After he coats it with scented oil in the middle, the practitioner then applies powder of five colors.
Then, the practitioner applies five colors of powder.
According to the rules, he makes a four-sided maṇḍala.
At the four entrances of the maṇḍala, he placed four guardian vials full of perfume.
He puts in four Shinga bottles full of perfume.
He placed four silver bowls full of food that had been born.
He placed four bowls full of flowers.
He placed his four swords and five-colored banners in his mouth.
He placed them one after the other like this.
Still, he placed three karpalas in the center of the maṇḍala.
He placed three karpalas.
Then, he placed the first one in the center of the maṇḍala.
He recites the great teaching and blesses it seven times.
Put it on top of the three karpāras.
Again, he burns an incense stick and recites the great teaching.
He makes three snapings of his fingers with that blessing.
That kovidāra then immediately emits a light.

source_sentence: 行人視之見如前鏡中之事。
translation: The practitioner looks at it and sees things in a mirror like the one before.

source_sentence: 乃至得見那拏天及諸眷屬。
translation: He might even see Nāna Heaven and his retinue.
He says to the practitioner.
"He says, 'Whatever the practitioner asks, he'll get it as he wishes.'

source_sentence: 如上曼拏羅乃至葛波羅等成就法。
translation: "Thus, the maṇḍala and even the khāpala accomplish this.
That's for every man and woman.
They must arouse a bold, resolute, and beneficial intention.
They'll all attain it if they do this.

source_sentence: 除大五逆及謗毀佛法不識恩德者。
translation: Except for the five heinous crimes and those who denigrate the Buddha's teachings and don't recognize merit.

source_sentence: 不唯不得成就亦復不得見聞是法。
translation: Not only will they not attain them, but they also won't be able to see or hear this teaching.

source_sentence: 又復行人欲入阿脩羅宮及龍宮者。
translation: Another practitioner who wants to enter the palace of Ashura or the palace of the dragon should recite the teaching twenty-one times.

source_sentence: 當依法誦大明二十一遍。
translation: He should recite the great teaching according to the Dharma twenty-one times.
Burning the incense of Anshi, they'll all be able to enter.
Again, he'll burn the incense of Anshi and recite the great teaching.
He then beats the dragon's pool with a white mustard seed.
Then, he makes a stake out of khānīla wood.
He nails it into the dragon pool and then restrains it.
If he wants to do so, he'll remove the stake and burn the incense of Anshi.

source_sentence: 當出彼橛燒安悉香即得如故。
translation: He'll remove the stake and burn the incense of Anshi, and it will be as it was before.
If he wants to subdue a hostile group, he'll use a stake made of iron and recite the great chant according to the rules.

source_sentence: 當用鐵作橛依法誦大明。
translation: You should use a stake made of iron to recite the great teaching according to the Dharma.
He should recite the great teaching according to the Dharma and hold it twenty-one times.
Burn an incense stick to scent it.
Nail it to the bottom of a large tree, and the resentful array will be subdued.
If you take that peg, you'll be able to act as before.
Those who want to understand the hold of the constellations and celestial bodies should burn an incense of siddhi to perfume the person they're holding.

source_sentence: 當燒安悉香熏所執人身。
translation: You should burn the fragrance of Anshi to perfume the person he's holding.

source_sentence: 誦大明加持白芥子及水。
translation: Recite the great invocation, bless it with white mustard seed and water, and sprinkle it on his body.
Sprinkling that person's body will remove it.
Those who want to get rid of the malaria diseases should recite the great teaching with five-colored thread.

source_sentence: 當用五色線誦大明加持已。
translation: He should use five colored threads, then recite the great teaching and blessing.

source_sentence: 燒安悉香熏繫患者身瘧病即差。
translation: Burn a scent of anxiety to perfume the body of the person tethered to it, and the malaria will go away.
Those who want to be freed from the restraints should recite the great teaching 800 times.
He should recite the great teaching 800 times.
All the prohibitions will be freed.
If he wants to be freed from the fetters, he'll recite the words of the great teaching and blessing.
Recite the great invocation and bless it.
Burn a white mustard seed perfumed with the incense of Anṣi.
He'll beat it and be freed.
If he wants to move a thunderbolt to another place.
He should use a pomegranate branch.

source_sentence: 若欲止雨者當用葛囉尾囉枝。
translation: If you want to stop the rain, you should use a branch of keraweera.
If you want to get grain, you should use seven kinds of grain to make a protective cloth.
You should use seven kinds of grains to guard and moisten.
He'll then be able to do as he wishes.
If he wants to send down rain, he should use tallow and millet as a guard.

source_sentence: 當用脂麻及粳米同作護摩。
translation: He should make a guard of sesame and millet together.
It will then rain down.
"If he wants to ward off the yakṣas, then he'll use chaff as a guard.
He'll use chaff as a guard and moat.
If he wants to get rid of illnesses, he'll use tallow and oil as a guard and moisturizer.
He'll use tallow and hemp-seed oil as a guard and moisturizer.
If he wants to remove poison from other places, he'll use peacock tail as a guard.
He'll use peacock tail.
Those who want to pursue well-being should use peacock tail as a guard.

source_sentence: 但當至意持念即常安樂。
translation: He should simply hold mindfulness with the utmost attention, and then he'll always be at peace.
This is great insight.
It's a teaching that's well-crafted and accomplished by a hundred thousand things.

source_sentence: 當依法念誦及用安悉香。
translation: He should recite the teaching according to the method and use the scent of an esoteric incense.

source_sentence: 所作皆成此法於諸法中最為殊勝。
translation: Whatever he does, it accomplishes this teaching, which is the most excellent of all teachings.

source_sentence: 佛說最上祕密那拏天經卷下
translation: Foshuo zuishang mimi na na tian jing roll second
